CONGRATULATIONS KAMBREA D. SHAW
ON WINNING THE ROY MARTIN SCHOLARSHIP

One of the Lions of Greenwood Scholarship winners is Kambrea D. Shaw. Kambrea is the winner of the Roy Martin Scholarship.

She is the daughter of Tijwana Shaw of Greenwood and Kendrick Shaw of Fort Worth, TX. Kambrea is currently a senior at Greenwood High School, a member of National Beta Club and the National Honor Society. She has and is currently taking dual enrollment courses through MDCC and has successfully completed 16 college hours. Kambrea has maintained good grades in all courses while working a part time job as a cashier. Kambrea has received acceptance letters from University of Southern Mississippi, Mississippi State, Delta State, Hinds Community College and Northwest Community College. She has decided to first attend NWCC with the intent to transfer to MSU to continue her major in elementary education She plans to ultimately obtain her Masters Degree in education.

ATTENTION ALL GLCSD SENIORS

RE: SENIOR PORTRAITS

The Greenwood Commonwealth is in the process of obtaining senior portraits from Amanda Elzy High School, Greenwood High School and Leflore County High School for its annual graduation edition.

If you did not have your senior portrait taken by Lamb’s Photography, Bruckner’s Photography or any other photography company who knows to send your portrait to the newspaper, please tell your photographer to call David Monroe at the Greenwood Commonwealth at 662-453-5312 to ensure your senior portrait will be included in the special edition.
